Annotation Loading ModuleÔÉÅ

Module to load core annotation data.

This module provides functions for loading various types of annotation data into the ORF database, including genome assemblies, genes, transcripts, exons, UTRs, and CDS regions from different data sources.

orfdb.annotation_loading.load_genome_assembly(session, assembly_df, assembly_name)[source]ÔÉÅ

Load genome assembly information into the database.

Parameters:

  • session (Session) ‚Äì SQLAlchemy session

  • assembly_df (DataFrame) ‚Äì DataFrame containing assembly information

  • assembly_name (str) ‚Äì Name of the assembly

Return type:

None

orfdb.annotation_loading.load_gencode_exons(session, exon_gff_df)[source]ÔÉÅ

Load exons from GENCODE GFF file.

Parameters:

  • session (Session) ‚Äì SQLAlchemy session object

  • exon_gff_df (DataFrame) ‚Äì GENCODE GFF dataframe filtered for exons

  • assembly_ids ‚Äì Mapping of sequence IDs to assembly IDs

Return type:

None

orfdb.annotation_loading.load_gencode_transcripts(session, tx_gff_df, exon_gff_df, gencode_dir, version)[source]ÔÉÅ

Load transcripts from GENCODE GFF file.

Parameters:

  • session (Session) ‚Äì SQLAlchemy session object

  • tx_gff_df (DataFrame) ‚Äì GENCODE GFF dataframe filtered for transcripts

  • exon_gff_df (DataFrame) ‚Äì GENCODE GFF dataframe filtered for exons

  • gencode_dir (Path) ‚Äì Path to GENCODE directory

  • version (str) ‚Äì GENCODE version

  • assembly_ids ‚Äì Mapping of sequence IDs to assembly IDs

Return type:

Dict[str, List[Tuple[int, int]]]

Returns:

Dictionary mapping transcript IDs to exon information

orfdb.annotation_loading.load_gencode_utr(session, utr_gff_df, utr_class)[source]ÔÉÅ

Load UTRs from GENCODE GFF file.

Parameters:

  • session (Session) ‚Äì SQLAlchemy session object

  • utr_gff_df (DataFrame) ‚Äì Subset of the GENCODE GFF with UTR records

  • assembly_ids ‚Äì Mapping of GENCODE ‚Äòseqid‚Äô to internal database IDs

  • utr_class ‚Äì The UTR class to use (either UTR3 or UTR5)

Return type:

None

orfdb.annotation_loading.load_refseq_lncRNAs(session, lnc_gff_df)[source]ÔÉÅ

Load lncRNA transcripts from RefSeq GFF file.

This function is almost identical to load transcripts. In the GENCODE loading there is no distinction for transcripts/lncRNAs. However, in the RefSeq GFF there are a few different fields and clearly a different annotation process that make lncRNAs look more like genes. I still load them here as transcripts but it should be possible to merge this code with transcript loading in the future.

Parameters:

  • session (Session) ‚Äì SQLAlchemy session object

  • lnc_gff_df (DataFrame) ‚Äì RefSeq GFF dataframe filtered for lncRNA records

Return type:

None

orfdb.annotation_loading.load_refseq_transcript_exons(session, transcript_exon_map)[source]ÔÉÅ

Load transcript-exon relationships from RefSeq data.

Parameters:

  • session (Session) ‚Äì SQLAlchemy session object

  • transcript_exon_map (Dict[str, List[Tuple[int, int]]]) ‚Äì Mapping of transcript IDs to lists of (exon_number, exon_id) tuples

Return type:

None

orfdb.annotation_loading.load_refseq_exon_cds()[source]ÔÉÅ

TODO: Additional code needs to be written to try and map RefSeq exons to RefSeq CDS. For some reason this mapping is not provided in the GFF and so a position based lookup would be needed to enable loading this for RefSeq

orfdb.annotation_loading.load_chess_cds(session, cds_gff_df)[source]ÔÉÅ

Load CDS data from CHESS database.

This function processes and loads coding sequence (CDS) annotations from CHESS, creating new CDS entries and their cross-references.

Parameters:

  • session (Session) ‚Äì SQLAlchemy session object

  • cds_gff_df (DataFrame) ‚Äì CHESS GFF dataframe filtered for CDS regions

Return type:

None

orfdb.annotation_loading.load_gencode_lncRNA_genes(session, gene_gff_df)[source]ÔÉÅ

Load long non-coding RNA genes from GENCODE GFF data.

Parameters:

  • session ‚Äì SQLAlchemy session object

  • gene_gff_df (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì GENCODE GFF dataframe filtered for lncRNA genes

Note

Creates both gene entries and cross-references in the database. Handles duplicates by updating existing records.

orfdb.annotation_loading.parse_attributes(attr_str)[source]ÔÉÅ

Parse GFF/GTF attribute string into a dictionary.

Parameters:

attr_str (str) ‚Äì String containing semicolon-separated key-value pairs

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

Returns:

Dictionary of attribute key-value pairs

Example

>>> parse_attributes('ID=gene1;Name=BRCA1;gene_type=protein_coding')
{'ID': 'gene1', 'Name': 'BRCA1', 'gene_type': 'protein_coding'}
